Class AbstractGameController

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.framework.core.AbstractGameController
Direct Known Subclasses:
SameGameController
public class AbstractGameController extends Object
An abstract base class for game controllers in the framework. The controller orchestrates the game flow, manages the relationship between the AbstractGameModel and one or more GameViews, and handles user input via an InputStrategy.

Concrete game implementations will typically provide a specific controller that extends this class, possibly overriding methods to customize game setup or the main game loop if necessary.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractGameController

      public AbstractGameController()
      Constructs an AbstractGameController. Initializes the list of views. The model, views, and input strategy are typically set via setters or a GameFactory.

  • Method Details

    • setGameModel

      public void setGameModel(AbstractGameModel model)
      Sets the game model for this controller.
      Parameters:
      model - The AbstractGameModel to be controlled. Must not be null.

    • addGameView

      public void addGameView(GameView view)
      Adds a game view to this controller and registers it as an observer to the model.
      Parameters:
      view - The GameView to add. Must not be null.

    • removeGameView

      public void removeGameView(GameView view)
      Removes a game view from this controller and unregisters it from the model.
      Parameters:
      view - The GameView to remove.

    • setInputStrategy

      public void setInputStrategy(InputStrategy strategy)
      Sets the input strategy for this controller.
      Parameters:
      strategy - The InputStrategy to use for obtaining game actions. Must not be null.

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      Initializes the game. This typically involves initializing the model, then initializing and showing the views. Subclasses might override this to add game-specific setup steps.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the main game loop or prepares the game for playing. The base implementation here is conceptual. Concrete controllers might implement a more event-driven approach rather than a blocking loop. This method should be called after initializeGame().

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Cleans up resources when the game is over or the controller is disposed. This involves disposing of the views and the input strategy.

    • submitUserAction

      public void submitUserAction(GameAction action)
      Processes a game action that has been submitted externally (e.g., by a UI event). This method contains the core logic for validating and processing an action, and then checking for end-game conditions.
      Parameters:
      action - The GameAction to process.
